p: In addition, a similar relationship appears between the accuracy of the predicted peak magnitude and the PEMPM of predicted peak timing ( Fig 6, dashed lines). Further, this relationship for peak magnitude forecast accuracy was also clear for influenza B ( Fig 6C, dashed lines). For H3N2, the forecast accuracy for peak magnitude at 1–3 wk lead increased up to 89% as the PEMPM increased to 80–90% ( Fig 6B, 1 st row). These relationships indicate that the forecast systems are able to accurately predict both peak timing and peak magnitude at least 3 weeks in advance.
